New Records: The Guardians became the first AL team to score five runs before recording an out in a playoff game.
Key Match Events: The Guardians scored five runs in the first inning before recording an out.
Lane Thomas hit a three-run home run in the first inning.
Tyler Holton, the Tigers' opener, faced just four hitters without recording an out before being pulled from the game.
David Fry hit a two-run double in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians created a realistic environment in their simulated games during the bye week to prepare for the ALDS.
The Guardians emphasized the importance of having their leadoff hitter, Steven Kwan, healthy and mentally prepared for the playoffs.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch commented on the difficulty of overcoming the Guardians' five-run first inning.
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt highlighted the team's use of judgment in-game rather than blindly following numbers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians had a platoon advantage in an MLB-best 71.6% of their plate appearances in the regular season.
The only other game in which Cleveland scored five runs in the first inning of a postseason game was Game 1 of the 1997 ALDS against the Yankees.
